intro: Brauneria tennesseensis, commonly known as the Tennessee brauneria, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
